flock.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a group of sheep, goats, or birds
flock.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: a priest’s flock is the group of people who regularly attend his or her church
flock.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: small pieces of wool or cotton that are used for filling cushions
flock.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: a soft substance that is used to make patterns on the surface of wallpaper, curtains etc
flock.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: if people flock to a place, they go there in large numbers because something interesting or exciting is happening there
flock.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: People have been flocking to the exhibition.
Tourists flock to see the town’s medieval churches and buildings.
